title: Old Chevrolet logo serif
content:
Looks like a mix between Kepler Bold Italic SemiCondensed and Bauer Bodoni.

Any ideas?

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018054509im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chevy-font_4413.jpg)
author: paulstonier

comments.content:
When you say "old", what time are you talking about? (In other words Kepler (1996), for example, may have been developed later than the logo.)

Your image is way too blurry to make an ID, other than a rough guess. Right now I think this looks closer to [Century Expanded](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018054509/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/century-expanded/) than Bodoni.

- Mike Yanega

WhatTheFont suggested Kepler. Either way, the original typeface was probably pre-digital.

We're thinking 50s/60s. Closest digital we found was Monotype Modern and just modified to match.

Thanks for the input, Mike.
